I have two copies of the Koyo Gunkan, so I've listed one for sale on Ebay. =
 It is the cleanest and newest of my two copies, in very excellent conditio=
n. Buying it on amazon.co.jp would probably cost well over $50, so hopefull=
y this is a good deal:

http://cgi.ebay.com/ws/eBayISAPI.dll?ViewItem&item=
=3D190324387743

This is a a near-pristine copy of the Takeda clan's "Koyo =
Gunkan" a comprehensive history of the Takeda clan of 16th century Japan an=
d manual of war and philosophy.  Each chapter includes first the original a=
rchaic Japanese text followed by a modern Japanese translation, and a compr=
ehensive introduction gives details on the history of the Takeda clan, clan=
 genealogy, and a history of the circumstances of the Koyo Gunkan.  The boo=
k is hardcover in excellent condition, and comes with a hardcover case whic=
h is in great condition with a little shelf wear. 

Chapters include:

The =
Strategist Yamamoto Kansuke
The Removal of Takeda Nobutora from Kai Provinc=
e
The Destruction of Murakami Yoshikiyo at Uedahara
Battles at Kawanakajima=

Tokugawa Ieyasu and Oda Nobunaga at Mikatagahara
Shingen's last campaign
A=
 Hero Falls
Destruction at Nagashino
The End of the Takeda Clan
